content: For those interested - a simple ValueSet editor: https://fhirblog.com/2016/05/30/valueset-editor-in-clinfhir/
i'm definitely interested. haven't start looking hard at terminology tooling yet
couple of glitches and suggestions @David Hay - where would you like them?
here would be just fine - any comments welcomed! (especially bug reports :) )
cool
looks really useful
add is-a confused me for a bit - ? would "add entire branch" be better?
or at least putting a title tag on the button?
also i was deliberately naughty and named my set Erich's test which probably caused most of my other glitches...
I got the name from the terminology - but 'branch' does make more sense to the non-technical user... Perhaps call it 'branch' with a popover that describes what it does?
I see I shall have to get sterner with my validation
sounds good
In the SNOMED CT world the terms 'supertype' and 'subtype' are commonly used. When trying to add concepts to a value set manually, after query, I can't see the Add buttons in either IE11 or Chrome.
Wierd. what happens if you re-load the page and just click 'new'?
Oh - and you are using Grahames server?
I'm using Grahame's server and will try that after my next meeting. I could see the HTML for the buttons when I viewed source.
Thanks for testing! It's only a weekend old, so will doubtless have many issues. I use the ng-show / ng-hide a lot, so just seeing the html in the page doesn't necessarily mean it's visible...
Oh - and don;t forget that you can't change one of the existing valuesets - you can copy one and then edit it, or create one from scratch (preferred) - otherwise it will be read-only
I keep losing my set @David Hay !
is it supposed to persist?
you mean you save it and then can't find it?
yes
what name are you using?
mmm
maybe it was just the apostrophe
It sets the name property of the valueset to the name you enter, and then you should be able to search on that...
yes, please start with single words and see if that works and move on form there. I suspect an apostrophe will confuse it...
ok i'm good
its ok with Erich-test
whew! I'll beef up the validation as it's an easy mistake to make...
omg snomed is awful
http://www.clipular.com/c/4842662449905664.png?k=ekB1kAiHNM0Dyv_O1hF-dOx_U7A
i mean to say the Read codes were pretty rubbish too
portal != arterial hypertension... sigh
would be interesting to confirm the relationship in a tool like snapper to make sure it's not an artifact of the expansion on the server or the UI...
All works on the 'Select from binding' tab, but don't see the buttons after a lookup from the 'Enter Directly' tab.
OK - I'll check that out - I must admit I've always selected from binding first, then gone across to the 'enter directly' tab so that's likely what's happenning...
ah @David Hay that is reassuring...
http://www.clipular.com/c/5636012056772608.png?k=fCgJekGlqsXof754AIXc975seUA
that is from CSIRO.au shrimp
so that means that whatever is coming from from "Grahame's server" is flaky then
curious about the source of flakiness so I can avoid it (hunting out or making a nice ancestor table to do roll ups is on my todo list)
Interesting - I did wonder! Not too quick to blame Grahames server at the moment (in the past I've usually been the one wrong :( )

In discussions with michael lawley to use ontoserver as a source (some minor niggles with CORS at the moment) - so will see if we get the same results from there (suggesting an issue with the editor) or not - suggesting an issue with Grahames server. Hopefully that will happen soon (though shortly about to board a plan to the US which will slow things down a bit!)
btw @Peter Jordan - have fixed that issue with entering a code directly and tightened up the validation to deal with @Erich Schulz being difficult!

btw - have added ontoserver as a source. The process is a bit convoluted right now - the following should work:

1 Navigate to http://107.170.196.80/resourceCreator.html
2. From the gear menu (upper right) select 'reset config'
3 after the message navigate to http://localhost:8000/valuesetCreator.html
4. select 'ontoserver'
5. reload the page

will tidy later...
heh I can be more difficult @David Hay :-)
Now I'm really worried...
